owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property link and abstract concept to its origin movement. Example: Teoria dei moti dell'animo was formalised during Renaissance and belongs to it.
Inverse of BelongsTo

This property link the Iconographical motifs to all its known Iconographical Representations. Example: Last Supper Iconographical Motifs is linked to Florentine Last Supper, Da Vinci Last Supper, Nordic Last Supper ecc...
This property highlights the role of creator of an agent of an abstract concept.
Inverse of CreatedBy
Specialisation of VisualAtom. Identifying the Derivated Visual Atom of a Derivation Relation.
This property links a concept to a source that describes it
This property link an Iconographical Representation to the Theory it embodies inside it. Da Vinci Last Supper Iconography embodies Theory of Moti dell'Animo inside it.
Specialisation of VisualAtom. Identifying the Final Visual Atom of a Preparatory relation.
Specialisation of father property linking an element to its possible alternative dating.
Property specialisation of HasVisualAtom, linking an element to a Visual Atom identified as a character.

Specialisation of HasVisualAtom used to link an element to a visual Atom representing the composition (the order of figures and elements) of something. Eg: A photo of Last Supper marked in order to highlights the groupings of figures.
Inverse of IsDerivationInRelation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: Specialisation of HasVisualAtom. It link something to a visual Atom showing the geometrical elements of a Cultural Property. Eg: a photo highlighting the perspectical lines of Leonardo's Last Supper

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Inverse of RepresentSubject
This property link a Cultura Property to its iconographical representation. Ex: Cenacolo of Fuligno has a Florentine Last Supper Iconography.
Inverse of IsMediumInRelation
Inverse of IsInfluencedInRelation
Inverse of IsInfluencerInRelation
Inverse of IsOriginalInRelation
This property link an iconographical representation to a pictorial attribute part of it. eg: Last Supper has the figure of Christ inside it.
Inverse of IsPreparatoryWorkInRelation

Property linking an Owl:thing to a Visual Atom representing a significant visual feature of it. Eg: Da Vinci's Last Supper Iconography linked to a Visual Atom showing a photo of a representation identifiable as part of this Iconography
Inverse of CompriseIconography
This property highlights the influence that an artistic Theory has on an iconographical representation. At the moment no reification is provided.
Property used to describe the VisualAtom of the Influenced cultural property.
Property used to describe the VisualAtom of the Influencer cultural property.
Inverse of IntroducedBy
Inverse of HasAttribute
Coupled with IsOriginalRelation this property link a cultural Property to the DerivationRelation node. Specifically this property link the derivation one of the 2 Cultural Properties.
Inverse of DerivativeVisualAtom
Inverse of FinalVisualAtom
Coupled with IsPreparatoryWorkInRelation. This property link a Cultural Property to its PreparatoryRelation node. Specifically this property identify the final work of the relation.
Inverse of HasIconologicalMeaning
Coupled with InfluencerInRelation. This property links a Cultural Property to its influence relation node. Specifically this property identify the cultural property that is influenced by another one.
Coupled with InfluencerInRelation. This property links a Cultural Property to its influence relation node. Specifically this property identify the cultural property that influence the other one.

This property highlights the role of medium in the relation between 2 cultural properties. Eg: The incision from Pietro Birago of Last Supper was the medium of influence from Last Supper to the Flanders.
Coupled with IsOriginalRelation this property link a cultural Property to the DerivationRelation node. Specifically this property link the original one of the 2 cultural properties.
Inverse of OriginalVisualAtom
This property link an iconographical representation to another one that come immediately before it. Eg: The Florentine iconographical representation is the predecessor of Da Vinci's one.
Inverse of PreparatoryVisualAtom
Coupled with IsPreparatoryWorkInRelation. This property link a Cultural Property to its PreparatoryRelation node. Specifically this property identify the preparatory work of the relation.

It highlights the presence of an abstract concept inside a Cultural property. Eg: Da Vinci's iconographical rapresentation of Last Supper is present in a set of different Cultural Properties. Teoria dei Moti dell'animo is present in another set of other Cultural Properties.
Inverse of IsPredecessorOf
Inverse of HasIconographicalRepresentation
Inverse of HasVisualAtom
Specialisation of VisualAtom. Identifying the Original Visual Atom of the relation.
Specialisation of VisualAtom. Identifying the Preparatory Visual Atom of a Preparatory Relation.
Inverse of IsPresentIn
This property show the subject highlighted by the Iconographical Motifs
This property highlights who theorised a certain artistic theory.
Inverse of TheorisedBy
Mutuated from contextual description module, this property links an element to its dating node.
This property link the Dating node to its dating Event. The dating pattern is mutuated by the contextual description module.
Inverse of HasDatingEvent
Inverse of Arco:HasDating

Mutuated by Contextual Description module of Arco. This property links a work to a related one. The pattern used in Arco is maintained even if it is specialised by a new set of subproperties and subclasses.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Relation Description. This property describes the influence a work has on another one from a character point of view. Eg: Judas of Da Vinci Last Supper influenced the Judas of Gaudenzio Ferrari Last Supper

Property describing the influence a work has on another from a composition point of view. Eg: Marcantonio Raimondi Last Supper shows a composition influenced by the symmetry and the groupings of 3 of Leonardo Last Supper
Long description of an owl thing.

Property describing the geometrical influence a work has on another from a Geometrical point of view. Eg: The symmetry used in Leonardo Last Supper partially reused in Albrecht Durer Last Supper of 1523
Mention of other possible Iconclass Code
Long description of a relation between 2 entities in a RelatedWorkSituation class.
Mention of the typical Iconclass Code used to mark the episode of an iconographical motif.
Property used to indicate temporal information (birth date/death date/period of life)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This class represent a specification class for the "Concept" of Top Level Ontology. It is not thought to be directly instatiated, but only to be a collector of more defined abstract concepts as Artistic Theories, Iconographies, Iconologies interpretations and elements of paintings.

Artistic Theory groups all the theories conceived in the art domain. It specifically focus on theories of painting. Example: Moti dell'Animo. Theory with the Aim of expressing the range of human emotion inside a painting.

Specialisation of VisualAtom, it collects the atoms identified as being a character without a link to a special meaning. Eg: the figure of Judas in Last Supper is a character, but is not linked to his identification.
Specialisation of VisualAtom, it represent VisualAtoms identified to be representative of composition elements of a painting. Eg: the groupings of 3 figures in Last Supper.
Specialisation of VisualAtom. It comprise visual Atoms aimed at showing the geometrical elements of a painting. Eg: the perspective lines of Last Supper

Iconographical Motifs is the class aimed to collect all the single representations of different subjects. Example: the pictorical subject "Last Supper" has an iconographical Motifs. This motifs collects an x number of different single iconographical representations.

This class is the single iconographical representation. Each instance of this class could be present in different cultural properties and has a specific set of features that distinguish it from another one. Example: Florentine Last Supper is a way of representing Last Supper with certain temporal and location characteristics and with specific visual features.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Relation describing the derivation relation between only a part of a cultural property and another. Eg: Bayonne Tapestry is a derivation of Last Supper but only for the central composition, the background is totally different.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: It is a significant element of an iconographical representation. it difference itself from a simple visual features due to its having an indipendence from the representation itself. Example: Last Supper has inside it the figure of Peter. Peter is a character that is independent from a single painting.

Inspired by VIR: this class represent the minimum set of significative physical features without a linked meaning. Eg: the figure of Christ in Last Supper from Leonardo da Vinci is denoted by the set of colors that represent that figure inside the painting.
